result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erin Leroy Heard

records.addlTxt: 8:46 AM Defendant Erin Leroy Heard not in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Erin Leroy Heard.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls the case. Attorney Rosenthal has no information regarding nonappearance. Upon defendants failure to appear, State requests warrant and forfeiture of any bond. Court grants warrant and forfeiture of any bond previously ordered. State's witness also appears in court.
Defendant's demand for discovery and inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:36 PM Defendant Erin Leroy Heard in court.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman is on video. Court notes that the defendant does qualify for public defender representation but they do not have an attorney yet to assign to the case. Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds the waiver is knowingly and voluntarily made. Preliminary hearing is reset, defendant asks for preliminary hearing in October. State has no objection.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

This case has an adjourned initial appearance that was entered when the clerk pulled the complaint over. It did not and will not let me change it.  Heidl
no contact with Victim 1 on Id key or their address on Cumming Avenue, no weapons, No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:44 PM Defendant Erin Leroy Heard appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Reid appears in person on behalf of Defendant. Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case. Address updated. Acknowledges complaint, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Court accepts pleas.
State requests $2,000 cash, no contact with Victim 1 or address, no weapons, no drugs. Cites priors and prior FTA's.
Attorney Reid updates address with a Duluth address. Has some contacts with area. Has 2 jobs. Asks for signature bond or low cash.
Court orders $1000 cash with conditions of no contact with Victim 1 on Id key or their address on Cumming Avenue, no weapons, no drugs. Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
